titleStmt.title: A machine-readable list of linguistic features of Test Arabic
titleStmt.author: Test Author

sourceDesc.p: This is an original digital text

cit.note: Most commonly dialects show reflexes of CA man.

cit.quote: Who is this man? – He is my friend.
Whose car is this? – This is our car. It’s small but it’s good.
هذه سيارة من؟هذه سيارتنا. هي صغيرة ولكنها جيدة.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV with the grandmother.
يا فاطمة، ماذا تفعلين الآن؟أشاهد التلفزيون/التلفاز مع جدتي.

cit.note: A very common pattern are reflexes of CA li + ’ayy or li + ’ayy + šay’

cit.quote: Why didn’t he come? – I don’t know.

cit.note: A very common pattern are reflexes of CA fī + ’ayna

cit.quote: Where is my mobile (phone)? – Here it is!
Where is the car? – Here it is!
Where are you (f.) going? – I am going home.
Where are you (f.) from? – I am from Jendouba.
Where are you (pl.) from? –We are from Sfax.
Fatima, when did you see Muhammad? – I saw him yesterday.
يا فاطمة، متى رأيت محمدا؟رأيتُه أمس؟
How much is half a kilo of lemons? – It’s 1500 Millīm.
بكم نصف كيلو من الليمون؟ بـ...
How many children do you (f.) have? – I have two daughters and three sons.
كم ولدا عندكِ؟عندي بنتان وثلاثة أبناء.
In which neighbourhood do you live? – We live in the Nour neighbourhood.
Who is this man? – He is my friend.
Where is my mobile (phone)? – Here it is!
Where is the car? – Here it is!
We have been here for 8 years.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV with the grandmother.
يا فاطمة، ماذا تفعلين الآن؟أشاهد التلفزيون/التلفاز مع جدتي.
Hey kids, tomorrow you have to study.
يا شباب، غدا عليكم أن تدرسوا.
Last year we had many problems.
السنة الماضية كان عندنا مشاكل كثيرة.
My/The two cats eat the mice.
We have been here for 8 years.
There are 18 new students in our class.
Whose car is this? – This is our car. It’s small but it’s good.
My husband wears a white shirt.
I don’t like the black shirt.
I don’t like the black car.
My wife bought a pink shirt and a pink bag.
اشترت زوجتي قميصا ورديا وحقيبة وردية.
There are 18 new students in our class.
Fatima, what are you doing now? – I’m watching TV with the grandmother.
يا فاطمة، ماذا تفعلين الآن؟أشاهد التلفزيون/التلفاز مع جدتي.
Stay a bit longer! – No, I don’t have time.
ابقَ هنا قليلا!لا, ليس لديَّ وقت.
Do you speak Arabic? – Just a little.
Did you give the letter to Ahmad? – Yes, I gave it to him.
هل أعطيت أحمد الرسالة؟نعم، أعطيتُه إياها.
The children saw someone begging behind the house.
Do you (f.) want to drink coffee or tea? – Tea please.
هل تريدين أن تشربي قهوة أم شاياً؟أُريد شاياً، من فضلك.
Give me a big bottle, please! – I’m right with you.
من فضلك، اجلب لي الزجاجة الكبيرة.- تفضل!
They have a lot of money, but they are bad.
عندهم الكثير من النقود ولكنهم ناس سيئون.

cit.note: Many Arabic dialects use periphrastic constructions to render English ‛since’.

cit.quote: We have been here for 8 years.
What are those women doing there? – They are baking bread.
My husband wears a white shirt.
Who is this man? – He is my friend.
Where is my mobile (phone)? – Here it is!
Can you (~do you know how to) play chess? – Yes.
Do you speak Arabic? – Just a little.
There are 18 new students in our class.
Where is my mobile (phone)? – Here it is!
